newsitem.title: USA: Dow pares gains after Philly Fed, curbs lifted.
newsitem.headline: Dow pares gains after Philly Fed, curbs lifted.

text.p: The Dow industrials pared their gains in morning trading after a stronger-than-expected report on the economy clipped Treasuries.
Stocks and bonds eased after the Philadelphia Federal Reserve's June business activity index came in at 25.2, up from 1.6 in May. Economists had expected a reading of 7.3.
The Dow was up 13 points at 7732, off its earlier peak of 7775. The retreat led the New York Stock Exchange to lift its trading curbs at 1009 EDT/1409 GMT.
The 30-year U.S. Treasury bond was off 7/32, its yield rising to 6.71 percent from Wednesday's close at 6.69 percent.
The bond and stock markets are sensitive to any signs of a strengthening economy, which might lead to a Federal Reserve credit tightening.
Scott Bleier, chief investment strategist at Prime Charter Ltd, cited a sharp jump in the new orders index of the Philadelphia Fed survey. The index rose to 24.8 in June from 8.6 in May.
"It suggests a strong third quarter," Bleier said.
